subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of Kingsley font with Keyman program using J. F. Colson's mapping
msgSnippet: ... This is what the Shavian group does to send messages via the board. They have been playing with Uniscript, and finding it to be more trouble than it is
messageBody:
> Thanks for the reply. The interesting thing is the correct key
> strokes are still embedded in the message. If one simply copies the
> message, it can then be pasted into a word processor (assuming one
> has the proper font,...
This is what the Shavian group does to send messages via the board.
They have been playing with Uniscript, and finding it to be more
trouble than it is worth. What is nice, is that I can take their
messages, and apply a QS font to it, thanks to the backward
compatibility, and read it just fine. I cannot really read regular
Shavian.

-Av
